turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Where are you going?... To Montaldo's?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Then I'll go with you.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Have you read it?... They're asking for anyone with information to get in touch with them.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Yes. I had also thought of going there to talk with them...

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Yes, you should go.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: But then when will we see each other?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Sandro, I don't want you to come with me, I don't want to see you... How can I make it clear to you?...Why did you come?

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: I don't know why. I just couldn't help it.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: But sooner or later we've got to end this relationship. And it's better to do it right now.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: I have no desire to sacrifice myself... It's idiotic to sacrifice oneself... Why?... For whom? If Anna were here I might understand your scruples. But she's not...

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Oh, Sandro...

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: I'm sorry. I didn't want to sound cynical. But isn't it better to look things squarely in the eye?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: For me they are exactly as they were when we met three days ago -- just three days ago... don't you realize? And you and Anna... No, I guess they aren't like that any more. My God, is it possible to forget in such a short time, for things to change so quickly?

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: It takes even less.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: But it's so sad. So terribly sad. I'm not used to it, I'm not ready for it... You know... I have never been so upset in my life. Sandro, why don't you help me?

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: I think the only way to help ourselves, Claudia, is for us to be together.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: No, I'm sure it won't. Move over there. Let's make believe nothing happened. And when we get to the next station, get off.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: And what about you?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Me... I... I... Please leave me alone.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Claudia, listen to me...

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: No, Sandro, please... I ask you as a favor...

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Promise that you won't try to look for me... you shouldn't try to look for me any more...

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: But why, Claudia?... Why?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Any news?

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Yes... but it's all so conflicting... However, there is some slight indication...

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Let's get out of here, fast... This is not a town, it's a cemetery.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Who knows why they all left...

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Sandro ... maybe it's best that you go in alone.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Are you joking?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Don't think that I want to save myself from any embarrassment, from the awkwardness of meeting Anna... It's not that; it's that you can say certain things easier if you're alone. Please, Sandro, do try to understand me... It would look like I was trying to influence you, to force you, to control you... and that makes me feel uncomfortable...

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: What is it, Claudia?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Oh, Sandro... I'm so ashamed of myself, so ashamed...I tried to hide myself...I feel so small... I hate myself ...

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Does it please you to say such things?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Oh no... It doesn't please me at all...

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Then why do you say them?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Because what I'm doing is so ugly ... Because if you told me right now: "Claudia, I love you," I would believe you...

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Good. It's better if it were absurd. That would mean nothing much can be done about it.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: But just think -- the very same things you had said to her who knows how many times... maybe even just before we left, while I was waiting outside your place...

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: So, even if I did say them, I was sincere with her, as I am now with you.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Really, I've got to stop this business with Ettore... I would like to go back and start working on my own projects again. You know, I had many ideas...

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: And why did you drop them?

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Once they gave me a job to draw up an estimate for the construction of a school. It took me only a day and a half to finish it, and I got paid six million lire. Ever since then I've been doing estimates for other people's designs.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Why are you looking at me like that?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: I'm sure you'd be able to design some very lovely things.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: I don't know about that. And then, who's interested in beautiful things nowadays?

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Claudia, let's get married?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: What! Get married?

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Yes. We'll get married. You and I. What do you say?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: What do I say? What can I say? No. At least, not yet. I don't know... I can't even think of it... at a time like this... Oh, but why did you have to ask me?

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: You look at me as though I had said something foolish...

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: And are you sure you want to marry me? Are you really sure...that you want to marry... me?

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: That's why I asked you...

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: So... Oh, how I wish that everything were so much simpler... that people could just come together by the color of their hair or the size of their shoes. What size shoe do you wear? Size 9. That's a very lovely size. But I'm sorry, I wear size 8.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: But why am I so infatuated with you?

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Hurry up now, or it'll begin to get hot outside...

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Yes, yes, yes, yes... Right away...

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: And you leave me here all alone... in this hotel room...

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: As soon as you're ready, you can come down and catch up with me. I'll be waiting for you right outside on the square.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: But you know it already. Why must I tell you?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: So, you wonder why?

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Then I'll see you later.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Okay. In a few minutes.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Sandro ...What's the matter?

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: No, Sandro... Please...

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: No reason why...

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Sandro, wait a moment, just one moment... You seem like an entirely different person ...

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: And aren't you pleased?... That way you'll have a new kind of adventure.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: What are you saying?

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: I was only joking, really... Can't I make a joke? And now you've got to tell me why you don't want to.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Oh, Sandro... I want everything you do. But...

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Did the hotel manager speak to you about that place nearby?

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Yes, she started to but I didn't feel like staying to listen to what she had to say. If we had to listen to everybody...

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: No, Sandro... We should go. Besides, we haven't been in touch with anybody. Not even with Anna's father. We should have at least sent a wire or telephoned... let's be fair, he must be feeling awfully lonely.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: I don't doubt it. But at a time like this we're the least suitable persons to be with him. And as far as telephoning him... Who knows where he is?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Sandro, listen... Try not to get yourself too involved tomorrow.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Aren't you going to change?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: You said you wanted to quit working for Ettore.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Sandro, I'm not coming down.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: I'm too sleepy.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Sleep is something one must learn to overcome. I learned how to do it when I was a child. I never slept. And I had friends who even slept less than I did. The one who went to bed first, paid a penalty. And we really didn't do anything. After seeing a movie, we'd go to a cafe and discuss things for a while... then we'd sit down on a bench somewhere... listen to some drunkard... watch them putting up posters or manifestoes...or look at the sheep passing by... or go for a stroll around the market place... Or else we'd go and wake up some girl in the neighborhood by standing in front of her window and calling out her name...

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: You're that sleepy, eh? What time do expect to get up tomorrow?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Late, very late.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Good night, my love.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Good night. Tell me that you love me.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: I love you.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Tell me once more.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: I don't love you.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: I deserve it.

turns.speaker: PATRIZIA
turns.text: Well, with a shark running loose around the place, I for one won't get aboard that raft! They'll have to catch it first. I want to see it right here before my feet, dead or alive.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Better dead.

turns.speaker: PATRIZIA
turns.text: Tell me, Claudia, what do you think of Raimondo?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: I would say he's pretty depraved.

turns.speaker: PATRIZIA
turns.text: Oh no; quite the contrary. He's really just a child.

turns.speaker: PATRIZIA
turns.text: He amuses me. I don't know of anything more amusing. Outside of this jigsaw puzzle. Don't you find it so, Claudia?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: One would have to be in love with somebody to know that.

turns.speaker: PATRIZIA
turns.text: Have you ever been in love?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Not really... It's suffocating in here... Shall we go out?

turns.speaker: PATRIZIA
turns.text: What amazes me, is Sandro. He seems so calm.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Calm?... He doesn't seem so to me... He was awake all night.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: I'm going with the patrol boat to make a tour around the islands.

turns.speaker: PATRIZIA
turns.text: To do what?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: I just can't leave without first searching those islands, one by one.

turns.speaker: PATRIZIA
turns.text: But aren't you tired? I can just about manage to stand on my feet!  Raimondo!

turns.speaker: PATRIZIA
turns.text: But where did you finally end up?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: It was futile. We went all over.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: It's divine!

turns.speaker: PATRIZIA
turns.text: You say that just to flatter me.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Do you consider that a compliment?

turns.speaker: PATRIZIA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: I'm not coming.

turns.speaker: PATRIZIA
turns.text: But then why did you bother changing?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Shouldn't we try to find a quieter place?

turns.speaker: PATRIZIA
turns.text: Quieter? Oh, yes, of course.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: How do you manage to put up with all this confusion? You always said people bore you.

turns.speaker: PATRIZIA
turns.text: You shouldn't always take me seriously. Actually, I'm used to it by now. First my mother and now my husband; both of them are like dynamos.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: My childhood, instead, was a very sensible one.

turns.speaker: PATRIZIA
turns.text: What do you mean by sensible?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: It means being without money.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Patrizia... Patrizia ... Where's Ettore?

turns.speaker: PATRIZIA
turns.text: I imagine he must be inside sleeping.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Would you please see if Sandro is with him? He's not in his room. I'm sorry to disturb you.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Patrizia, I'm afraid.

turns.speaker: PATRIZIA
turns.text: More or less, we are all afraid. Especially at night.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: I'm afraid that Anna has come back. I feel she's back, and that they're together.

turns.speaker: PATRIZIA
turns.text: But what's gotten into you?... We would have known. Sandro must be out in the garden somewhere, taking a breath of fresh air, or watching the break of dawn. It would be a lovely surprise indeed if he turned out to be the sentimental type.

turns.speaker: PATRIZIA
turns.text: Now, listen. For God's sake, try not to let yourself become obsessed with that idea. Go to your room and get back into bed.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Just several days ago, the thought of Anna being dead would have made me sick. And now, I don't even cry, I'm afraid she might be alive. Everything is becoming so damned simple and easy, even to deprive one's self of pain and suffering.

turns.speaker: PATRIZIA
turns.text: You should never wish to get melodramatic over anything.

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: Yes, you're right. I'm sick and tired of being like that.

turns.speaker: GIULIA
turns.text: Who are you talking to?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: To the shark.

turns.speaker: GIULIA
turns.text: Please, you come too...

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: But for what reason should I come there?

turns.speaker: GIULIA
turns.text: Please, do come... Don't leave me alone with him. He's capable of... I don't know... Have you noticed his eyes?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: They're all nudes, if I'm not mistaken.

turns.speaker: GIULIA
turns.text: But why all nudes?

turns.speaker: GIULIA
turns.text: And tell Corrado, too, that I'm here... if he wants me. You can also tell him that my tiny little heart is beating like mad, and that at this moment, it's the only thing that interests me. Is that clear?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: It couldn't be any clearer.

turns.speaker: GIULIA
turns.text: Now what do I have to do to be left in peace?

turns.speaker: CLAUDIA
turns.text: I think all you have to do, Giulia, is to close the door.

turns.speaker: GIULIA
turns.text: It's as smooth and slick as oil.

turns.speaker: CORRADO
turns.text: I detest comparisons made with oil.

turns.speaker: GIULIA
turns.text: At one time the Aeolian isles were all volcanoes.

turns.speaker: CORRADO
turns.text: You must know your third grade geography book inside out.

turns.speaker: CORRADO
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: GIULIA
turns.text: There's a shark in the area. Don't move from where you are!

turns.speaker: CORRADO
turns.text: Who's moving?

turns.speaker: GIULIA
turns.text: Why didn't you ask me to go with you?

turns.speaker: CORRADO
turns.text: Do you know why? Because if you saw those ruins I'm sure you would have said they were very, very beautiful. You always say "how beautiful" to everything -- whether it's the sea, or a baby, or a cat! You have such a sensitive little heart that it throbs for anything.

turns.speaker: CORRADO
turns.text: But Corrado...  If something is beautiful why shouldn't one say so?

turns.speaker: GIULIA
turns.text: He never misses a chance to humiliate me, to let me know that he doesn't care about me any more.

turns.speaker: CORRADO
turns.text: Giulia, that remark is not worthy of our twelve years of honest concubinage. I repeat, once and for all, and publicly, that I admire you. Does that please you?

turns.speaker: GIULIA
turns.text: Looks like the weather is changing.

turns.speaker: CORRADO
turns.text: Please, Giulia; must you always emphasize the obvious? I can see for myself that the weather is changing.

turns.speaker: CORRADO
turns.text: I'll stay here also.

turns.speaker: GIULIA
turns.text: But why?... What if it starts to rain?

turns.speaker: CORRADO
turns.text: If it rains, I'll buy myself an umbrella.

turns.speaker: GIULIA
turns.text: How did you spend the night?... In that hut?... And what did you have to eat?

turns.speaker: CORRADO
turns.text: What do you think?

turns.speaker: GIULIA
turns.text: We, too, you know. It was disastrous. First at Panarea, where there weren't any boats... then at Lipari, where everybody was asleep... And the phone call to Rome...

turns.speaker: GIULIA
turns.text: Corrado, why don't you ask them to give it to us as a gift?

turns.speaker: CORRADO
turns.text: Really! So that you can stuff it with your geraniums.

turns.speaker: GIULIA
turns.text: But how can you carry on a discussion in this heat?

turns.speaker: CORRADO
turns.text: When one approaches fifty, my dear, he is affected only by the cold.

turns.speaker: CORRADO
turns.text: I'm going ashore to take a look around the island. There are some ruins up there...

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: There too...

turns.speaker: CORRADO
turns.text: Well, we're still in Italy, you know!

turns.speaker: CORRADO
turns.text: It's really a fact -- there's nothing new under the sun. Now, look here. Look at this structure... a kind of natural shelter. Sandro, that's how you should design your houses.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Me?... I no longer have any interest in building... And, then, where can you find boulders of rock like this in Milan?

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Let's try to be practical about this. The best thing to do is for all of you to go to the closest island that has a police station, or something, and report the disappearance. I'll remain here... because... well, I don't know, but it seems to me that something may turn up. Anyway, I just don't feel like leaving.

turns.speaker: CORRADO
turns.text: Then let's get started... It's senseless to waste any more time.

turns.speaker: CORRADO
turns.text: Claudia, I know how you feel, but there are already two of us staying...

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: I'll go even further and say that her presence here -- I don't want to sound offensive -- could be a great hindrance.

turns.speaker: CORRADO
turns.text: And what are we going to do now?

turns.speaker: MARSHAL
turns.text: We'll try again.

turns.speaker: MARSHAL
turns.text: Up until now those smugglers were operating only around the Palermo area. This will be a nice surprise for the Lieutenant in Milazzo... Call up headquarters. Bring them up to date and have them give you instructions on what to do with this crate.

turns.speaker: CORRADO
turns.text: So... the boat we saw yesterday afternoon might have also been that of these smugglers. Could it be possible, then, that Anna...?

turns.speaker: MARSHAL
turns.text: I wonder where they could have unloaded the stuff ... Maybe right here at Lisca.

turns.speaker: CORRADO
turns.text: I was saying... it might even be possible that Anna had left with them.

turns.speaker: MARSHAL
turns.text: But for what reason would she have wanted to go away?

turns.speaker: CORRADO
turns.text: Listen, Marshal... As for there being reasons for going away, anyone of us might have three thousand of them. So you can assume that she had them. What I want to know, is it possible that the smugglers might have taken her aboard?

turns.speaker: MARSHAL
turns.text: I think it's possible.

turns.speaker: ETTORE
turns.text: And who is this?

turns.speaker: PATRIZIA
turns.text: This is Claudia, Anna's friend...  You've never met my husband, have you?

turns.speaker: PATRIZIA
turns.text: First let the poor thing have something to eat.

turns.speaker: ETTORE
turns.text: It wouldn't really do you any harm to skip a meal.

turns.speaker: PATRIZIA
turns.text: Ettore...

turns.speaker: ETTORE
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: PATRIZIA
turns.text: Nothing, nothing  at all. I was just looking for Sandro.

turns.speaker: ETTORE
turns.text: And you expect to find him in here? Go and ask Claudia.

turns.speaker: PATRIZIA
turns.text: Yes, yes, of course.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Let's see you dive from the top of those rocks, Giulia. That would be really sensational.  Come on, Giulia ... your life is much too circumscribed.

turns.speaker: GIULIA
turns.text: What has everybody got against me this morning?

turns.speaker: GIULIA
turns.text: Where is she going?

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Ask her.

turns.speaker: GIULIA
turns.text: The trouble with you is that nobody can speak to you, that's all.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Giulia, don't you understand that the more involved you become with people, the more difficult it is to speak with them?

turns.speaker: GIULIA
turns.text: You men are all so dreadful!

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: I know we are. But as the years go by, we become even worse. Isn't that so, Corrado?

turns.speaker: GIULIA
turns.text: Goffredo is the Princess' nephew. He's eighteen years old, the lucky boy. And, what do you know -- he paints.

turns.speaker: GOFFREDO
turns.text: Anybody can hold a brush in his hand. All you need is to buy some oils and start painting. Even Rembrandt did the same.

turns.speaker: GOFFREDO
turns.text: Giulia...

turns.speaker: GIULIA
turns.text: Here I am.

turns.speaker: GOFFREDO
turns.text: Because there is no landscape as beautiful as a woman.

turns.speaker: GIULIA
turns.text: And where do you find the models?

turns.speaker: GOFFREDO
turns.text: Oh, there are as many as one wants.

turns.speaker: GIULIA
turns.text: I thought the model was something obsolete nowadays. Didn't you, Claudia?

turns.speaker: GOFFREDO
turns.text: It's strange how anxious women are to display themselves. It's almost a natural inclination.

turns.speaker: GIULIA
turns.text: But how could they pose like that? I couldn't.

turns.speaker: GOFFREDO
turns.text: Why don't you try?

turns.speaker: GIULIA
turns.text: Me... Goffredo, you're mad!  He's mad.

turns.speaker: GIULIA
turns.text: Don't you ever paint men?

turns.speaker: GOFFREDO
turns.text: Answer me, why don't you try posing? I'll paint you a beautiful portrait.

turns.speaker: GIULIA
turns.text: But why me?... Ask Claudia, she's much more beautiful than me.

turns.speaker: GOFFREDO
turns.text: But I want to paint you. You appeal to me more.

turns.speaker: GIULIA
turns.text: I appeal to you more?

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: They tell me you have a lot of trouble at home. Is that right?

turns.speaker: YOUNG SAILOR
turns.text: Yes, sir. My sister is sick... and my father, too.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: So that's why you've turned to smuggling, eh? You need the money. Now, I can help you. I can see that you get some assistance from the government. But first there's a little formality we've got to take care of. Just a few questions and then we can all go to lunch... Your friend tells me you dropped anchor three times...

turns.speaker: YOUNG SAILOR
turns.text: Yes, sir. Three times.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: Now, we're getting somewhere! They're beginning to contradict each other.  Now look here, your friend just swore to me that you weren't able to do any fishing at all because the sea was too rough... And what about the other boat?

turns.speaker: YOUNG SAILOR
turns.text: What other boat?

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: Now look, my men saw it and they also saw you men throwing those crates overboard. What have you got to say about that?

turns.speaker: YOUNG SAILOR
turns.text: I ... I ... wasn't feeling well ... I.. I was sleeping... I don't know anything ... I ... I'm all mixed up and ...

turns.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE
turns.text: I work there but I'm really a stranger.

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: I tell you this acquaintance of mine knows you and she has often spoken to me about you.

turns.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE
turns.text: And who is she? Does she work in Catania?

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: Yes, she takes care of the garden.

turns.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE
turns.text: Then it's impossible for her to know me. In the villa where I'm at, we have a male gardener.

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: So? That's logical. You see, both being gardeners, they spoke about you to one another.

turns.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE
turns.text: And what did they say about me?

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: They told me that you were a very nice girl, that you always mind your business... In other words, things of that sort.

turns.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE
turns.text: We have a radio like this, too.

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: No, not like this one.

turns.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE
turns.text: And why wouldn't we have one like this?

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: Because this is a Chinese radio.

turns.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE
turns.text: Certainly a radio this small is very practical. It's especially useful for... I don't know... for traveling.

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: But for you, what comes first: music or love?

turns.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE
turns.text: Music, of course. To get a sweetheart, one has to look around, but to get a radio, all you have to do is buy one.

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: Ah, no... For me, love comes first. I'm a man, and I know what's what: first love, and then music.

turns.speaker: MARSHAL
turns.text: Anything new develop?

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Unfortunately, no.

turns.speaker: MARSHAL
turns.text: Very well. First of all, I'll have them search the waters around the island. I brought two frogmen with me... Meanwhile, we'll take a look up around here.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Look, Marshal, with those deep crevasses, you'll need some rope and ladders...

turns.speaker: MARSHAL
turns.text: Don't worry, we've got everything.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Another thing; there's an old man who lives here on the island...

turns.speaker: MARSHAL
turns.text: I know, I know. One thing at a time.

turns.speaker: MIDWIFE
turns.text: I only exchanged a few casual words with her, as one would ordinarily do on a public bus...

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: And do you remember where she got off?

turns.speaker: MIDWIFE
turns.text: Well...probably at the last stop, which is Noto.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Then you should also be able to tell me where a young girl might stay in Noto; are there any hotels or rooming houses?

turns.speaker: MIDWIFE
turns.text: There's the Trinacria Hotel... or the Regina, near the municipal building. As for rooming houses, I don't know...

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: MIDWIFE
turns.text: Don't mention it... Pleased to be of service any time.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Are you the owner of this place?

turns.speaker: OLD MAN
turns.text: No. The owners are in Australia.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: But where did you come from?

turns.speaker: OLD MAN
turns.text: From Panarea. Why?

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Whose boat is that?

turns.speaker: OLD MAN
turns.text: What boat?

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Just a moment ago... didn't you hear the sound of a motor?

turns.speaker: OLD MAN
turns.text: At this time of the year there are so many boats...

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: And how come you're up so early?

turns.speaker: OLD MAN
turns.text: Early? Is four in the morning early for you?

turns.speaker: PATRIZIA
turns.text: Perhaps she wasn't feeling well... Maybe a cramp or something...

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Anna is an excellent swimmer. Even with a cramp, she would have managed to reach shore somehow.

turns.speaker: PATRIZIA
turns.text: But you have to  consider all possibilities, Sandro.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Listen, Patrizia... The Marshal says there's a current that passes by here and ends up at another island... I don't know which... He wants to send one of his men over to have a look... One never knows... Do you mind if I ask Raimondo to go with him?

turns.speaker: PATRIZIA
turns.text: I don't see why I should mind.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Patrizia, what are you going to do?

turns.speaker: PATRIZIA
turns.text: What do you want us to do? I don't know myself... But we'll do something.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: I'll go and get my valise.

turns.speaker: PATRIZIA
turns.text: We've decided to go to Montaldo's place. In fact, Ettore should already be there.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Good. Then I'll meet you there.

turns.speaker: PATRIZIA
turns.text: And here's Sandro.  Why don't you two go upstairs and change?

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Yes, we will.

turns.speaker: PATRIZIA
turns.text: Did you manage to find good rooms?

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: They didn't seem too good.

turns.speaker: PATRIZIA
turns.text: You should have told Ettore. He always manages to get what he wants.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Ettore must be fed up with me by now.

turns.speaker: PATRIZIA
turns.text: Oh, no, not at all. And then you know very well that he'll forgive you anything; just as long as you admit to him that you're a worse driver than he is...

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Your mother?

turns.speaker: PATRIZIA
turns.text: Yes, even I had a mother. She was part Austrian, but she was still my mother. My childhood was like a tennis match; they bounced me back and forth, here and there...

turns.speaker: PATRIZIA
turns.text: Why have we stopped?

turns.speaker: RAIMONDO
turns.text: Lady Patrizia!

turns.speaker: PATRIZIA
turns.text: Raimondo... Do you enjoy fishing underwater?

turns.speaker: RAIMONDO
turns.text: I detest it. But, after all, what can you do... It's the latest...and I try my best to adapt myself.

turns.speaker: PATRIZIA
turns.text: Now, tell the truth, aren't you a bit disappointed?... But I already told you...

turns.speaker: RAIMONDO
turns.text: If women's breasts were colored, yours would be blue...

turns.speaker: RAIMONDO
turns.text: Patrizia, don't start in again... I would rather be called depraved. Unless you happen to love children.

turns.speaker: PATRIZIA
turns.text: You know, I don't love anybody.

turns.speaker: RAIMONDO
turns.text: I know, dammit, I know!  And just think -- if there ever was a woman so right, so perfectly cut out for all kinds of dissipations, degradations, infidelities... of.. . of... of debaucheries, it's her. Well, anyway, she's faithful. Faithful out of laziness... of unwillingness.

turns.speaker: RAIMONDO
turns.text: You've made some mistake there with the bushes... that's why you can't finish it.

turns.speaker: PATRIZIA
turns.text: Take it easy, Raimondo. Why are you getting so impatient?

turns.speaker: RAIMONDO
turns.text: Here I am, Patrizia. I'm always here.

turns.speaker: PATRIZIA
turns.text: Claudia isn't coming with us. Will you please take care of her luggage? Thanks.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Zuria?

turns.speaker: ZURIA
turns.text: Yes. Until proven otherwise.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: I would like to ask you something.

turns.speaker: ZURIA
turns.text: Wait a moment. Can't you see I'm busy?

turns.speaker: ZURIA
turns.text: She costs a hundred thousand lire.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: You're kidding!

turns.speaker: ZURIA
turns.text: No, I'm not. Why do you think she does all this? It's one of the many ways she can put herself on display. When you bait the trap, the mouse will snap. To tell you the truth,  if it wasn't for the fact that one hundred thousand lire represents my whole month's salary, well... But you had something you wanted to ask me?

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: I read one of your articles regarding the disappearance of a girl. I'm that girl's fianc.

turns.speaker: ZURIA
turns.text: Oh... I'm sorry I have to rush but I've got to write a story about this thing that just happened... Tell me exactly how it all turned out.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Now listen, if I had any information, I wouldn't have come here to ask you. But I see that you, too, lack any information ...

turns.speaker: ZURIA
turns.text: As a matter of fact, I've already had several phone calls on that article. One said they had seen the missing girl in an automobile somewhere in Rome. Another one said they saw her on the pier talking with some strange sailors... Could be she secretly left the island by boat...

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Is that possible?

turns.speaker: ZURIA
turns.text: Who knows?... Another one has it that she entered a store in Troina. This information comes from the storekeeper himself who stated that such and such a girl had bought I don't know what in his store... at Troina.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Is that far from here?

turns.speaker: ZURIA
turns.text: About fifty miles or so. If you want, I'll give you the name of the storekeeper.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Yes... of course... But you should also print that in your paper... But right away, tomorrow morning... It's the local Palermo paper, isn't it?... I mean, it's widely read...

turns.speaker: ZURIA
turns.text: Yes, but why do you think our readers would be interested in such news now? Even if I sent it, the editors wouldn't print it.

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: You really must do me this one favor.

turns.speaker: ZURIA
turns.text: Pardon me, but why must I do you a favor?

turns.speaker: SANDRO
turns.text: Then let's call it a business proposition. Something to round out your salary.

turns.speaker: MOTHER MIRIAM
turns.text: Agnes, it has come to my attention that you have stopped eating. Why is this? AGNES  I've been commanded by God.

turns.speaker: MOTHER MIRIAM
turns.text: He talked to you Himself?

turns.speaker: AGNES
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MOTHER MIRIAM
turns.text: Through someone else?

turns.speaker: AGNES
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: MOTHER MIRIAM
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: AGNES
turns.text: I can't say.

turns.speaker: MOTHER MIRIAM
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: AGNES
turns.text: She'd punish me.

turns.speaker: MOTHER MIRIAM
turns.text: One of the other Sisters?

turns.speaker: AGNES
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MOTHER MIRIAM
turns.text: Who?
